question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable and demonstrable. Help me create an animal translator, which is an HTML software that can translate human language into animal language.

checklist.title: Is the core translation engine fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements the translation logic from human language to animal language through JavaScript, including multiple animal language types (cat, dog, bird, etc.) and proper phonetic mapping algorithms. Score 0 if no translation logic is implemented, 5 if only basic single animal translation exists, and 10 if multiple animal languages with comprehensive vocabulary mapping are included.

checklist.title: Is the language input and output system properly designed?
checklist.description: Check whether the input system supports multiple formats (text input, voice recognition, file upload) and the output system provides various presentation methods (text display, audio playback, visual phonetics). Deduct 5 points if voice input/output is missing, and 3 points if no input validation is implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the animal language database comprehensive and accurate?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the animal language system includes scientifically-based or creatively consistent language rules, proper grammar structures, and vocabulary databases for different animals. Two-way translation capability is required. Deduct 5 points if animal languages lack consistency or logical structure. Check whether multiple animal species are supported with distinct linguistic characteristics. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the user interaction workflow complete and intuitive?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes complete user workflow management, including language selection, translation history, favorites, and sharing functionality. Deduct 5 points if translation history is not implemented, and 3 points if no progress indicators are shown during translation. Give 10 points if the complete user journey is seamlessly integrated.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as empty input, unsupported characters, network issues, browser compatibility problems, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Real-time pronunciation guide with IPA notation 2. Animal avatar animations that speak the translated text 3. Cultural context explanations for animal communication patterns 4. Batch translation for conversations). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple translation engines coexisting unnecessarily) 2. Function modules unrelated to animal translation (e.g., a built-in weather widget) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive particle animations during translation). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core translation functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating translation logic/UI components/data layers), code organization, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or proper separation of concerns is not implemented; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if no proper error handling or logging mechanisms exist. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching with animal-themed aesthetics (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional typography system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times) 4) Intuitive iconography for different animals. Deduct 3 points for each cramped visual element, 5 points for jarring color combinations, and 5 points for chaotic layout hierarchy. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Translation trigger response delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animations between different animal modes controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual feedback during translation process 4) Smooth animal character animations if present. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for laggy animations during mode switching, and 5 points for unclear translation status indicators. The full score is 10 points.
